ai.summary: Crowan FP 68 is a short, easy 3.2 km hike in the UK. It's suitable for beginners and families, with gentle terrain and minimal elevation.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail comprises mostly well-maintained gravel or compact paths and grassy sections. Expect some gates or stiles and occasional uneven ground after rain; proper footwear is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather before you go. Wear sturdy, comfortable footwear and bring a light waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths, keep younger hikers close, and carry a map, phone, and basic first aid. Be mindful of livestock or animals on farmland sections and adhere to access rules. Start early in winter daylight conditions.
recommended_gear: Map or GPS device / smartphone with offline map
ai.best_seasons: Year-round with proper clothing; spring and summer offer longer daylight and milder conditions, while autumn and winter require waterproofing and shorter daylight.

seo.title: Crowan FP 68 – Easy 3.2 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Crowan FP 68, a gentle 3.2 km hike in the UK. Easy terrain, practical safety tips, and gear recommendations for a family-friendly outdoor stroll.
